result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant failed to appear for plea date.   Bench warrant authorized and forfeiture of any cash bail.   
Court sets bail at $1000.00 cash.   The no return on warrant is ordered and defendant must be brought before the judge for a bail hearing.   
State is withdrawing all offers.  
Minutes.

DEFENDANT TO BE BROUGHT BEFORE THE HONORABLE MARK R. ROHRER FOR A BAIL HEARING.  

DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.
Scheduling conference on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant John L Howard appeared by video.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for John L Howard. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.

Defendant is to be denied by Public Defender for special bail appearance and must report to the jail for booking. 
The warrant will not be canceled by the court but is holding the issuance of the warrant until the end of the plea date calendar.
